organization: Indian Government Websites and Critical Infrastructure (Post-Operation Sindoor)
attackMethod: Coordinated APT campaign, DDoS attacks, malware injections, phishing campaigns
rootCause: Geopolitical retaliation following Operation Sindoor military strikes, coordinated multi-nation APT groups
impact: 1.5 million cyberattacks attempted against Indian websites, 150 successful intrusions recorded, targeting government, banking, healthcare, and critical infrastructure
description: Following India's Operation Sindoor military strikes against Pakistan, a massive coordinated cyber retaliation campaign was launched. Seven APT groups from Pakistan, Bangladesh, Indonesia, and the Middle East targeted Indian digital infrastructure. This represents the largest coordinated cyber warfare campaign against India to date.

details.Actors: 7 APT groups primarily from Pakistan, Bangladesh, Indonesia, and Middle East
details.Targets: Government websites, banking systems, healthcare infrastructure, critical national infrastructure
details.Motivation: Geopolitical retaliation, cyber warfare in response to military operations
details.Consequence: CERT-In issued emergency alerts, enhanced cyber defense protocols activated

attackMethod: Data exfiltration, extortion, physical intimidation tactics
rootCause: Continued exploitation from 2024 breach, escalated threat tactics
impact: Continued exposure of 31 million customer records, death threats to executives, bullet cartridges mailed to CEO and CFO
description: The Star Health data breach escalated when hacker 'xenZen' mailed bullet cartridges to company executives as threats. The attacker cited denied medical claims as motivation, marking evolution from cybercrime to cyber-enabled physical intimidation.

details.Targets: Star Health executives, continued data distribution
details.Motivation: Hacktivism regarding denied medical claims, intimidation tactics
details.Consequence: Law enforcement investigation, enhanced executive protection protocols

organization: Multiple Indian Organizations - Hacktivist DDoS Campaign

attackMethod: Distributed Denial of Service attacks, service disruption campaigns
rootCause: Politically motivated hacktivist groups targeting Indian organizations
impact: Over 100 Indian organizations across various sectors faced service outages, no data theft but significant operational disruption
description: In 2025, Indian organizations across multiple sectors experienced a surge in DDoS attacks from hacktivist groups. While no data was compromised, the large-scale service outages demonstrated infrastructure vulnerabilities and the growing threat from politically motivated cyber actors.

details.Actors: Various hacktivist groups from Southeast Asia
details.Targets: Over 100 Indian organizations across government, private, and educational sectors
details.Motivation: Political protest against Indian policies, service disruption
details.Consequence: Enhanced DDoS protection measures, infrastructure hardening

organization: Indian State Load Dispatch Centres (SLDCs) - Power Grid

attackMethod: Targeted SCADA system infiltration and espionage malware
rootCause: Nation-state actors targeting critical infrastructure, SCADA system vulnerabilities
impact: At least 7 State Load Dispatch Centres compromised, potential for grid manipulation, PLA-linked threat actors identified
description: A sophisticated cyber espionage campaign targeted at least seven State Load Dispatch Centres responsible for electrical grid control via SCADA systems. The campaign, linked to PLA threat actors, represents a significant escalation in cyber threats against India's critical power infrastructure.

details.Motivation: Strategic intelligence gathering, potential infrastructure disruption
details.Consequence: Emergency security audit of all critical power infrastructure, enhanced monitoring
